page.title: 02LIVERPOOL FESTIVAL GARDENS
page.content: In the South West corner of our survey block is the redeveloped{Herculaneum} {Dock.}It was filled in to make the main car park for the{International} {Garden Festival of 1984.}The gardens have now been re-opened, due to public demand, in a smaller form. Some of the attractions include many of last year's favourites such as the{Dragon {Slide, Yellow Submarine, Tea Boat, {Blue Peter and the Chinese Water {Garden and Falls. The Festival Hall has re-opened as a{Magic Garden including a{Giant's Garden where everything, like a fallen tree, a spade, a tap etc. is ten times larger than life. The International Garden Festival was one of the largest projects ever undertaken on{Merseyside and was visited by millions of people.
